# 1. Import data:

## Import spatial data

First extract the reefs of interest from the GBRMPA shape file:

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=3.5, fig.height=5, cache=TRUE}

library(oceanwaves)
library(dhw)
library(sf)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(ggplot2)


### download GBR shape file
gbr_shape <- download_gbr_spatial(return = "base") |>
  select(LOC_NAME_S, X_COORD, Y_COORD) |> 
  st_make_valid() |> 
  st_transform(20353)


### Grep subset for target reefs
whitsundays <- gbr_shape |> 
  filter(grepl("Hook|Hayman|reef", LOC_NAME_S)) |> 
  filter(grepl("20", LOC_NAME_S))

ggplot() + theme_bw() +
  geom_sf(data=whitsundays, aes(fill=LOC_NAME_S), show.legend=FALSE)

```

To calculate wave exposure, we want a series of points surrounding the outer reef / island boundaries (land-sea interface):

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=3.5, fig.height=5, cache=TRUE}

whitsundays_union <- whitsundays |>
  st_union() |>
  st_boundary() |>
  st_cast("LINESTRING")



ggplot() + theme_bw() +
  geom_sf(data=whitsundays_union, show.legend=FALSE)
```

Finally, for For fetch calculations, extract the broader seascape surrounding the reefs of interest:

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.5, cache=TRUE}

### extract broader region for fetch (50km from focus reefs)
whitsundays_region <- st_crop(gbr_shape, 
                              whitsundays |>
                                st_union() |> 
                                st_centroid() |> 
                                st_buffer(20000))

ggplot() + theme_bw() +
  geom_sf(data=whitsundays_region) +
  geom_sf(data=whitsundays, aes(fill=LOC_NAME_S), show.legend=FALSE)

```

## Import weather data

The `extract_wunderground()` function extracts wind data (speed, bearing) from [Weather Underground](http://wunderground.com) (requires API key for access). To test functionality here, extract dates around Nov/Dec spawning window for the past 2 years and plot to check timeseries (plot by 3-hrly averages)

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=FALSE, cache=TRUE}

spawning_dates <- seq(ymd("2018-11-01"), ymd("2024-12-31"), by = "day") %>%
  keep(~ month(.) %in% c(11, 12)) %>%
  format("%Y%m%d")

whitsundays_weather <- extract_wunderground(stations="ISHUTE4", daterange = spawning_dates, apikey="5cada843ef8e4f39ada843ef8e4f392d")

# plot by 3hrly average:
whitsundays_weather |>  
  mutate(time = ymd_hms(time)) |> 
  mutate(year = as.factor(year(date))) |> 
  mutate(time_3hr = lubridate::floor_date(time, unit = "3 hours"), show.legend=FALSE) |> 
  group_by(time_3hr, year) |> 
  summarise(
    speed = mean(windspeed_ms, na.rm = TRUE),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) |> 

ggplot() + theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~year, scales="free", nrow=2) +
  geom_line(aes(x = time_3hr, y = speed, color=year)) +
  labs(x = "Time (3-hourly)", y = "Wind Speed (m/s)", title = "3-Hourly Average Wind Speed") 


```


```{r, eval=TRUE, echo=TRUE, fig.height=6, fig.width=9, include=TRUE, cache=TRUE}

whitsundays_weather <- readRDS("/Users/rof011/oceanwaves/data/whitsundays_weather.rds") 

bearingplot <- whitsundays_weather |>
```

# 2. Calculate points

Generate a series of points along the boundaries to calculate fetch:

```{r, fig.height=5.5, fig.width=3.5, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, cache=TRUE}

whitsundays_points <- calculate_points(whitsundays_union, 500)

ggplot() + theme_bw() +
  geom_sf(data=whitsundays, aes(fill=LOC_NAME_S), show.legend=FALSE) +
  geom_sf(data = whitsundays_points, shape=21) 


```

# 3. Calculate fetch

For each point calculate the bearings and corresponding fetch length (note - only mapping 10 points for clarity)

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.height=5.5, fig.width=4.5, cache=TRUE}

whitsundays_fetch <- calculate_fetch(point = whitsundays_points, 
                                     degrees = 7.5, 
                                     fetch = 5000, 
                                     land = whitsundays_region, 
                                     parallel = TRUE, 
                                     cores = 8)

ggplot() + theme_bw() +
  geom_sf(data = whitsundays, aes(fill=LOC_NAME_S), show.legend=FALSE) +
  geom_sf(data = whitsundays_fetch |> filter(id %in% sample(whitsundays_fetch$id, 10)), linewidth=0.2, show.legend=FALSE) 

```


# 4. Calculate waves

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.height=5.5, fig.width=5, cache=TRUE}

whitsundays_waves <- calculate_waves(wind = whitsundays_weather, 
                                     fetch = whitsundays_fetch, 
                                     points = whitsundays_points, 
                                     parallel = TRUE, 
                                     cores = 8) |> 
                      drop_na(wave_energy)

ggplot() + theme_bw() +
  geom_sf(
    data = whitsundays |>mutate(habitat = if_else(!grepl("Reef", LOC_NAME_S), "island", "reef")),
    aes(fill = habitat),
    color = "black",
    linewidth=0.1
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("island" = "#ffffc0", "reef" = "#e6f8ff")) +
  ggnewscale::new_scale_fill() +
  geom_sf(data = whitsundays_waves, aes(fill = wave_energy), shape = 21, size = 3) +
  scale_fill_distiller(palette = "RdYlBu", guide = guide_colorbar(title = "Wave Energy"))


```
